thread.title: Comment on Derek Willis Out Two Weeks by AzubuikeandFitch
thread.title_full: Comment on Derek Willis Out Two Weeks by AzubuikeandFitch

author: AzubuikeandFitch
title: Comment on Derek Willis Out Two Weeks by AzubuikeandFitch
text:
Posted in Basketball , Main , Top Story | 11 Responses 
Junior Derek Willis will miss the next two weeks due to a finger injury suffered in practice on Saturday. Willis is expected to return for October 27th’s scrimmage. According to Coach Calipari, it is nothing serious and he will be ready for the season. Derek sustained the injury in today’s practice. Heal up quickly, Derek. You’ve been great in practice the last couple weeks. 
— Kentucky Basketball (@KentuckyMBB) October 10, 2015 It’s nothing serious and Derek will be back in a couple weeks, but I’m disappointed for him because he had been doing so well. 
— John Calipari (@UKCoachCalipari) October 10, 2015 
Get well soon, Derek! Article written by Trey Huntsman Keepin' fresh since '96. Covering baseball and football while studying on occasion. Follow me on Twitter @TreyHuntsmanKSR. 11 responses to “Derek Willis Out Two Weeks” Who Cares October 10, 2015 at 7:35 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Can’t wait for this pos to be off the team. FU and your dirty birds October 10, 2015 at 7:56 pm | Permalink 
Can’t wait for U of L’ s entire athletics department staff and players to die in a fire so I can piss gas on it Katmancsm October 10, 2015 at 7:39 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Trolls out early. October 10, 2015 at 7:58 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Practice team is going to run short for two weeks. Damn. @BallBlog_Chad October 10, 2015 at 9:03 pm | Permalink 
Can still run 5s with Floreal without going to the two new walk-ons, he should know the system and be able to help the freshman Rump Shaker October 10, 2015 at 8:46 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Feel bad for him. Bit at least it is only our bench guys getting banged up. Hal October 10, 2015 at 8:52 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Did Willis and Brian Long break up or are they still together? bbn4LIFE October 10, 2015 at 9:03 pm | Permalink | Reply 
This man has practiced with the best players in the country for 3 damn years and is still just a bench player. Not even a solid contributor. Tells me all I need to know about him. Can’t wait for the “why doesn’t Willis play more” calls from the same people who ask “why doesn’t barker get to play” smh. leon singleton October 10, 2015 at 9:19 pm | Permalink 
Your mama is bad In the sack. One Eyed Willie October 10, 2015 at 9:25 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I know his dad. After his freshman year he was contacted by someone at IU and thought about transferring there. Rixter October 10, 2015 at 11:41 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I love that Cal takes players from U of L that he doesn’t even want.
